meanings.definition: The mental process by which a person makes sense of an idea by assimilating it to the body of ideas he or she already possesses.
meanings.sent1: Her apperceptions of the story were influenced by her previous readings.
meanings.sent2: The psychologist studied the patient's apperceptions to understand their thought process.
meanings.sent3: His apperceptions of the alien invasion in the movie were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, apperceptions were like puzzle pieces fitting together.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful images to help the students grasp the concept of apperceptions.

meanings.definition: The act of understanding and interpreting new experiences in relation to past experiences.
meanings.sent1: Through his apperceptions, he was able to navigate through the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent2: Children often rely on their apperceptions to learn new things.
meanings.sent3: Her apperceptions of the magic show made her laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: To him, apperceptions were like connecting dots from the past to the present.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture illustrating the concept of apperceptions.
